Dear Hagop,

 

To finalize the report, the loss adjuster needs to clear the following 2 aspects: 

 

1.	Cost price of the damaged items – Please provide the ERP records to confirm the WAC costs, for the various items.
2.	Adequacy of Sum Insured – There is a very specific Sum Insured for Stock in the policy - AED 164,517,697. Can we please understand the basis of this amount? Would there be any other way to establish adequacy of sum insured?

To finalize the report, the loss adjuster needs to clear the following 2 aspects: 

 

1.	Cost price of the damaged items – Please provide the ERP records to confirm the WAC costs, for the various items.
2.	Adequacy of Sum Insured – There is a very specific Sum Insured for Stock in the policy - AED 164,517,697. Can we please understand the basis of this amount? Would there be any other way to establish adequacy of sum insured?

 

Please let us have the destruction certificate for the damaged stock as well.

 

Regards,

Dear Rukshad,

 

The loss adjuster needs documentation showing total value of stock present in the warehouse at the time of the incident, not only the damaged stock. 

 

Above should show the cost value as well. 

 

Also,  update on the second point: 

 

•                  Let us have the purchase invoices for the highlighted items. - The items are belonging to very old shipments; hence we were not able to get the purchase invoices. Shall we consider the value in the system and go ahead with the destruction process ? [Jibin Kodiat]  Please let us have any evidence of the purchase cost for these items.

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara

Dear Team,

 

Greetings.

 

Please find the below comments received from loss adjuster.

 

•                  Stock records of the warehouse – please send us the full document with values. – Attached[Jibin Kodiat]  The attached documents do not appear to relate to the total stock records of the warehouse. We need to understand the total value of stock present in the warehouse at the time of the incident, along with the list and cost value.

•                  Let us have the purchase invoices for the highlighted items. - The items are belonging to very old shipments; hence we were not able to get the purchase invoices. Shall we consider the value in the system and go ahead with the destruction process ? [Jibin Kodiat]  Please let us have any evidence of the purchase cost for these items.

 

 

Please review and update us on the above.

 

 

 

Best Regards,

 

Yogesh Naresh Patil 

Assistant Claims Manager - General Insurance

Dear Praveen,

 

Further to the below, loss adjuster needs a clarification on the cause of the damage since loss adjuster was advised that the damage to the stock occurred due to the heavy rainfall sustained at the premises on 17 November 2023.

 

However, the incident report states that the damage occurred as a result of a blockage within a drainpipe of the AHU system.

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara
Claims Manager – General Insurance

Dear Hani, Dear Yogesh,

 

With reference to the Property Insurance policy of Allied Enterprises LLC, kindly note that there was a heave leakage from the HVAC system of the DIP warehouse. (DOL: 22/11/2023)

 

DUBAI INVESTMENT PARK - Plot 598-294 Offices & Warehouses - Main, WH 24,25,28 

 

Please find enclosed the incident report and the list of damaged items.

 

In case you need to appoint a surveyor, please request the surveyor to co-ordinate with Mr. Praveen Kamalakshan copied within this e-mail.

 

Appreciate if you would open a claims file.

Dear Rukshad,

 

The loss adjuster needs documentation showing total value of stock present in the warehouse at the time of the incident, not only the damaged stock. 

 

Above should show the cost value as well. 

 

Also,  update on the second point: 

 

•                  Let us have the purchase invoices for the highlighted items. - The items are belonging to very old shipments; hence we were not able to get the purchase invoices. Shall we consider the value in the system and go ahead with the destruction process ? [Jibin Kodiat]  Please let us have any evidence of the purchase cost for these items.

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara

Dear Team,

 

Greetings.

 

Please find the below comments received from loss adjuster.

 

•                  Stock records of the warehouse – please send us the full document with values. – Attached[Jibin Kodiat]  The attached documents do not appear to relate to the total stock records of the warehouse. We need to understand the total value of stock present in the warehouse at the time of the incident, along with the list and cost value.

•                  Let us have the purchase invoices for the highlighted items. - The items are belonging to very old shipments; hence we were not able to get the purchase invoices. Shall we consider the value in the system and go ahead with the destruction process ? [Jibin Kodiat]  Please let us have any evidence of the purchase cost for these items.

 

 

Please review and update us on the above.

 

 

 

Best Regards,

 

Yogesh Naresh Patil 

Assistant Claims Manager - General Insurance

The loss adjuster needs documentation showing total value of stock present in the warehouse at the time of the incident, not only the damaged stock. 

 

Above should show the cost value as well.

Dear Team,

 

Greetings.

 

Please find the below comments received from loss adjuster.

 

•                  Stock records of the warehouse – please send us the full document with values. – Attached[Jibin Kodiat]  The attached documents do not appear to relate to the total stock records of the warehouse. We need to understand the total value of stock present in the warehouse at the time of the incident, along with the list and cost value.

•                  Let us have the purchase invoices for the highlighted items. - The items are belonging to very old shipments; hence we were not able to get the purchase invoices. Shall we consider the value in the system and go ahead with the destruction process ? [Jibin Kodiat]  Please let us have any evidence of the purchase cost for these items.

 

 

Please review and update us on the above.

 

 

 

Best Regards,

 

Yogesh Naresh Patil 

Assistant Claims Manager - General Insurance

Dear Praveen,

 

Further to the below, loss adjuster needs a clarification on the cause of the damage since loss adjuster was advised that the damage to the stock occurred due to the heavy rainfall sustained at the premises on 17 November 2023.

 

However, the incident report states that the damage occurred as a result of a blockage within a drainpipe of the AHU system.

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara
Claims Manager – General Insurance

Dear Hani, Dear Yogesh,

 

With reference to the Property Insurance policy of Allied Enterprises LLC, kindly note that there was a heave leakage from the HVAC system of the DIP warehouse. (DOL: 22/11/2023)

 

DUBAI INVESTMENT PARK - Plot 598-294 Offices & Warehouses - Main, WH 24,25,28 

 

Please find enclosed the incident report and the list of damaged items.

 

In case you need to appoint a surveyor, please request the surveyor to co-ordinate with Mr. Praveen Kamalakshan copied within this e-mail.

 

Appreciate if you would open a claims file.

Dear Team,

 

Greetings.

 

Please find the below comments received from loss adjuster.

 

•                  Stock records of the warehouse – please send us the full document with values. – Attached[Jibin Kodiat]  The attached documents do not appear to relate to the total stock records of the warehouse. We need to understand the total value of stock present in the warehouse at the time of the incident, along with the list and cost value.

•                  Let us have the purchase invoices for the highlighted items. - The items are belonging to very old shipments; hence we were not able to get the purchase invoices. Shall we consider the value in the system and go ahead with the destruction process ? [Jibin Kodiat]  Please let us have any evidence of the purchase cost for these items.

 

 

Please review and update us on the above.

 

 

 

Best Regards,

With reference to the Property Insurance policy of Allied Enterprises LLC, kindly note that there was a heave leakage from the HVAC system of the DIP warehouse. (DOL: 22/11/2023)

 

DUBAI INVESTMENT PARK - Plot 598-294 Offices & Warehouses - Main, WH 24,25,28 

 

Please find enclosed the incident report and the list of damaged items.

 

In case you need to appoint a surveyor, please request the surveyor to co-ordinate with Mr. Praveen Kamalakshan copied within this e-mail.

 

Appreciate if you would open a claims file.

Hani Gebara

With reference to the Property Insurance policy of Allied Enterprises LLC, kindly note that there was a heave leakage from the HVAC system of the DIP warehouse. (DOL: 22/11/2023)

 

DUBAI INVESTMENT PARK - Plot 598-294 Offices & Warehouses - Main, WH 24,25,28 

 

Please find enclosed the incident report and the list of damaged items.

 

In case you need to appoint a surveyor, please request the surveyor to co-ordinate with Mr. Praveen Kamalakshan copied within this e-mail.

 

Appreciate if you would open a claims file.

To finalize the report, the loss adjuster needs to clear the following 2 aspects: 

 

1.	Cost price of the damaged items – Please provide the ERP records to confirm the WAC costs, for the various items.
2.	Adequacy of Sum Insured – There is a very specific Sum Insured for Stock in the policy - AED 164,517,697. Can we please understand the basis of this amount? Would there be any other way to establish adequacy of sum insured?

 

Please let us have the destruction certificate for the damaged stock as well.

 

 

Best Regards,

To finalize the report, the loss adjuster needs to clear the following 2 aspects: 

 

1.	Cost price of the damaged items – Please provide the ERP records to confirm the WAC costs, for the various items.
2.	Adequacy of Sum Insured – There is a very specific Sum Insured for Stock in the policy - AED 164,517,697. Can we please understand the basis of this amount? Would there be any other way to establish adequacy of sum insured?

 

Please let us have the destruction certificate for the damaged stock as well.

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara
Head of General Claims

Dear Team,

 

Greetings.

 

Please find the below comments received from loss adjuster.

 

•                  Stock records of the warehouse – please send us the full document with values. – Attached[Jibin Kodiat]  The attached documents do not appear to relate to the total stock records of the warehouse. We need to understand the total value of stock present in the warehouse at the time of the incident, along with the list and cost value.

•                  Let us have the purchase invoices for the highlighted items. - The items are belonging to very old shipments; hence we were not able to get the purchase invoices. Shall we consider the value in the system and go ahead with the destruction process ? [Jibin Kodiat]  Please let us have any evidence of the purchase cost for these items.

 

 

Please review and update us on the above.

 

 

 

Best Regards,

 

Yogesh Naresh Patil

رسالة من مرسل خارجي - كن حذرًا مع الروابط والمرفقات

Dear Praveen,

 

Further to the below, loss adjuster needs a clarification on the cause of the damage since loss adjuster was advised that the damage to the stock occurred due to the heavy rainfall sustained at the premises on 17 November 2023.

 

However, the incident report states that the damage occurred as a result of a blockage within a drainpipe of the AHU system.

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara
Claims Manager – General Insurance

2.	Adequacy of Sum Insured – There is a very specific Sum Insured for Stock in the policy - AED 164,517,697. Can we please understand the basis of this amount? Would there be any other way to establish adequacy of sum insured?

Dear Rukshad,

 

The loss adjuster needs documentation showing total value of stock present in the warehouse at the time of the incident, not only the damaged stock. 

 

Above should show the cost value as well. 

 

Also,  update on the second point: 

 

•                  Let us have the purchase invoices for the highlighted items. - The items are belonging to very old shipments; hence we were not able to get the purchase invoices. Shall we consider the value in the system and go ahead with the destruction process ? [Jibin Kodiat]  Please let us have any evidence of the purchase cost for these items.

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara

Dear Team,

 

Greetings.

 

Please find the below comments received from loss adjuster.

 

•                  Stock records of the warehouse – please send us the full document with values. – Attached[Jibin Kodiat]  The attached documents do not appear to relate to the total stock records of the warehouse. We need to understand the total value of stock present in the warehouse at the time of the incident, along with the list and cost value.

•                  Let us have the purchase invoices for the highlighted items. - The items are belonging to very old shipments; hence we were not able to get the purchase invoices. Shall we consider the value in the system and go ahead with the destruction process ? [Jibin Kodiat]  Please let us have any evidence of the purchase cost for these items.

 

 

Please review and update us on the above.

 

 

 

Best Regards,

 

Yogesh Naresh Patil

رسالة من مرسل خارجي - كن حذرًا مع الروابط والمرفقات

Dear Praveen,

 

Further to the below, loss adjuster needs a clarification on the cause of the damage since loss adjuster was advised that the damage to the stock occurred due to the heavy rainfall sustained at the premises on 17 November 2023.

 

However, the incident report states that the damage occurred as a result of a blockage within a drainpipe of the AHU system.

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara
Claims Manager – General Insurance

To finalize the report, the loss adjuster needs to clear the following 2 aspects: 

 

1.	Cost price of the damaged items – Please provide the ERP records to confirm the WAC costs, for the various items.
2.	Adequacy of Sum Insured – There is a very specific Sum Insured for Stock in the policy - AED 164,517,697. Can we please understand the basis of this amount? Would there be any other way to establish adequacy of sum insured?

 

Please let us have the destruction certificate for the damaged stock as well.

 

 

Best Regards,
